page.title: 05PORTHLEVEN SHIPYARD
page.content: Porthleven Shipyard is not really a shipyard. It used to be but it isn't now. It is more of an industrial estate these days and has all sorts of things going on in the buildings. There are twenty-five buildings altogether. Nine of them are vacant, the others are rented by small businesses. There is a river running next to it which used to give the electricity to the shipyard. Its power was harnessed by turning a water wheel. The water wheel has been taken away now, but you can still see where it was. Most of the buildings are rented out by local people who start small businesses. They are used for things like building supplies, service places for cars and motor-bikes and store-houses for fishermen. Its got quite a busy atmosphere and most of its occupants are friendly.
